title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Act establishes the Office of Environmental Education. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act (20 U.S.C. 5503) is amended to include balanced and scientifically sound support. The Office of Environmental Education shall have a headquarters staff of up to 10 full-time equivalent employees and be supported by 1 full-time equivalent employee in each Agency regional office. The Administrator may carry out specified activities directly or through grants, agreements, or contracts. SEC. 3. ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION GRANTS amended to reduce funding for lobbying activities. SEC. 4. ENVIRONMENTAL INTERNSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS introduced. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by striking and redesignating sections, along with making conforming amendments to various sections and tables of contents. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by redesignating sections and making conforming amendments to various sections and tables of contents, including changes to sections 6, 9, and 10. SEC. 5. NATIONAL EDUCATION AWARDS. The Administrator may provide awards known as the 'President's Environmental Youth Awards' to young people in grades kindergarten through 12 for outstanding projects promoting local environmental awareness. SEC. 6. ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION ADVISORY COUNCIL AND TASK FORCE. Section 8 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to specify the composition of the Advisory Council and Task Force, including representation from various sectors such as education, not-for-profit organizations, and business. Membership on the Task Force is open to representatives of any Federal agency engaged in environmental education. The Advisory Council under the National Environmental Education Act will now hold biennial meetings to discuss timely issues and provide recommendations on environmental education. SEC. 7. NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOUNDATION. The name "National Environmental Education and Training Foundation" is changed to "Foundation for Environmental Education" in various sections of the National Environmental Education Act. The National Environmental Education Act changes the name from "National Environmental Education and Training Foundation" to "Foundation for Environmental Education" in different sections, including the Board of Directors increasing from 13 to 19 members. The Education Act is amended by changing the number from 13 to 19. Section 9 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended by removing paragraph 3 in subsection (d). The Education Act is amended by changing the number from 13 to 19. Section 9 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended by removing paragraph 3 in subsection (d). Authorization of appropriations is granted in Section 8. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. Funds are allocated for various environmental education activities, grants, and the Foundation for Environmental Education. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. Funds are allocated for environmental education activities, grants, and the Foundation for Environmental Education. 10 percent of the funds shall be used for the Foundation for Environmental Education, and not more than 25 percent may be used for administrative expenses. SEC. 9. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by this Act shall take effect as of October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of this Act.
